titles.title: RS275 God's glory fills the universe,

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
God's glory fills the universe,
the heavens proclaim his power;
but small and weak the Word made flesh,
and dark and brief his hour!
The mystery sought through ages past
is born with human face;
the treasure of eternal love
dwells with the human race.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
His words and signs of healing power
are wonders to the poor;
blind eyes, cold heaerts protest an d scheme
till love stands judges by law.
Let peace and mercy weep apart,
and justice, truth, take flight
when God's own Word to silence falls
and darkness veils the Light.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Uplifted on the Cross, Christ bears
ouir shame in his disgrace,
his outstretched arms enfold us all
and heaven and erarth embrace.
For Love will know the darkest depths,
and taste our bitterest pain
to prove himself their vanquisher,
and spring from buried grain.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
The Lord ascends, and death bows down
to his triumphant name.
The Spirit stirs our sleeping faith
in wind and tongue of flame.
Christ strengthens us, calls us to live
as children of the day,
to shine where shadows still oppress,
to walk his risen way.
